summary.para: Copies the whole input tensor to the output, then overwrites selected indices with corresponding values from the updates tensor. This operator performs the following pseudocode.
summary.code: output = input output[index[i, j, k, ...], j, k, ...] = updates[i, j, k, ...] // if axis == 0 output[i, index[i, j, k, ...], k, ...] = updates[i, j, k, ...] // if axis == 1 output[i, j, index[i, j, k, ...], ...] = updates[i, j, k, ...] // if axis == 2 ...
summary.para: If two output element indices overlap (which is invalid), then there's no guarantee of which last write wins.
A tensor containing the indices into the output tensor. The Sizes must match InputTensor.Sizes for every dimension except Axis.

Starting with DML_FEATURE_LEVEL_3_0, this operator supports negative index values when using a signed integral type with this tensor. Negative indices are interpreted as being relative to the end of the axis dimension. For example, an index of -1 refers to the last element along that dimension.

member.name: DML_SCATTER_OPERATOR_DESC.UpdatesTensor
member.summary: A tensor containing the new values to replace the existing input values at the corresponding indices. The Sizes of this tensor must match IndicesTensor.Sizes. The DataType must match InputTensor.DataType.

member.name: DML_SCATTER_OPERATOR_DESC.OutputTensor
member.summary: The tensor to write the results to. The Sizes and DataType of this tensor must match InputTensor.

member.name: DML_SCATTER_OPERATOR_DESC.Axis
member.summary: The axis dimension to use for indexing in OutputTensor, ranging [0, OutputTensor.DimensionCount).
